review_text: Wonderfully serene place to visit, in a beautiful setting and with kind monks.  The crypt is open to the public, and is accessible through the courtyard to the left once you’ve entered.  It is indeed “silent as a tomb” and starkly beautiful. There’s a small gift shop as well.
Total surrender to the Almighty God is guaranteed by the silence observed in the abby.  Simple yet majestic
Very quiet and solitude place. The monks are helpful and friendly

Have stayed here as guest before and became a part of the community for a fewdays.
Im not a catholic but fitted in with the few days of reflection towards God. The monks have very little distractions due to the minimalist architecture but this enhances their  worship .
What was nice to see was a younger generation of monks having joined since i was last here 10 or so years ago
If you want to find peace of mind and are curious about monastic life this is for u!

Very closed community of religious people, not my style!
A bit strange place behind the walls.
An ideal Abbey for a retreat and reflection located in a beautiful village surrounded by woods.
